result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo M. Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM Defendant Ricardo M. Ramirez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Caley in court for Ricardo M. Ramirez.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM. Request for extension to file comp report.  Atty Caley does not object to the extension.  Report to be filed by 11/14/22.   CH 11/16 1030am. Bond continued.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Complaint and Order for Comp Exam sent to DHS and WISCS.
CR-205 sent to KCJ.

236 PM
State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Referred to Br. 1 for Final pre-trial/comp hearing on 10/27/22 @10:30am. Bond continued as previously set. Attorney's motion for competency exam-court orders comp exam.  ec
for Comp Exam filed by Atty Caley

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Caley. Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Caley requests adjmt - case is new.  State indicates case is likely to resolve. FPT 10/27 1030am. Bond continued.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:   Tamara R

149 PM
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley. Clerk JT  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Plea of Not Guilty entered. Further proceedings scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am. $1500Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). ec
and witness list filed by the State
